attributes.action: ALLOW A SECOND VOTE FOR BREXIT BEFORE END OF TRANSITION PERIOD
attributes.additional_details:
The public was deceived when they initially voted for leaving the E.U. It is not fair that the people couldn't have a second referendum to leave where we, the public, are fully aware of all the consequences, potential downfalls and possible benefits for leaving. 
Scotland and NI and a lot of people in England never wanted to leave.
The vote for Boris in December is not an excuse not to do a 2nd ref. because that was voting for a party who were for Brexit not specifically if we want to leave.
attributes.background:
The government should allow the British public to have a vote before the end of the transition period. 
After COVID-19 especially, it is important that the public has a vote which is specifically FOR or AGAINST officially leaving the European Union in a clear and transparent way.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300026
